content: REITs Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Jun 2019Which industrial reit would you choose? MapleTree Industrial Trust or Ascendas REIT? Why?Which do you think will fare better in the long run?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gavin TanLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 12 Jun 2019Mapletree Industrial Trust (MIT) @ 2.14 PriceP/B ratio = 1.42Distribution Yield = 5.68%Gearing = 33.8%Ascendas REIT @ 2.97 PriceP/B Ratio = 1.39Distribution Yield = 5.40%Gearing = 36.3%Overall MIT is a better pick, due to a slightly higher distribution yield and lower gearing, but right now it is pretty expensive @ 1.42 PB ratio, so maybe wait for it to drop in price before picking it up?3 comments1

See all 3 comments Question Poster12 Jun 2019I'm quite new to reits, and I would like to find out If I were to purchase MIT using a RSP, do I have to be concern about the current price?Gavin Tan12 Jun 2019Hey Question Poster, personally, I feel that it would not matter because if you invest regularly, the price will be averaged down. A common phrase you'll hear is always "Having time in the market, is better than timing the market itself"

Tan Wei MingLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 12 Jun 2019Hi, I actually analysed Mapletree Industrial Trust and Ascendas Reit in January 2019. Before analysing both REITS, I always felt that both are equally good. However, I feel that AREIT is far more superior that MIT in almost all the categories that I compared. I would still choose AREIT over MIT but there is no harm in buying MIT. If I have spare cash, I would buy MIT too if I want to own as many industrial buildings in Singapore.0 comments0
